result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Zachery James Shircel
Current: 7530 W. View Drive, Wind Lake, WI 53185 United States  (Effective: 10-11-2022)
Prior: N6637 Juniper Rd, Elkhorn, WI 53121
Signed bond filed with the court.
See signature bond for conditions.

BOND TO COVER 22GF975 & 22CM311

DEFENDANT MUST POST $2500 CASH. Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH D.S. OR RESIDENCE ON JUNIPER RD IN ELKHORN. If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. 
22-4398 thru 22-4400
Notice of Bail Bond Forfeiture and Hearing. Bond set 6/3/2022.

Called at 1:16 pm. Defendant Zachery J Shircel in court, in custody by video. Samuel Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jonathan LaVoy appeared. Record by the court as to risk assessment. Discussion as to bond. Record by the State as to discussions with the victim. Wants no contact back in place and is asking for as much cash as possible. Further record as to new referral for damage to property in alcohol related incident. ADA Berg responds to Court's questions. Response by Attorney Lavoy who objects to amount of cash. Grandmother in court and can post some cash. Further record as to combat veteran, PTSD issues. Response by court as to concerns. Sets total bond, $10,000 signature with $2500 cash component. Prior bond forfeited. State to file complaint in two weeks. Minutes filed.
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Zachery James Shircel in court.  Attorney Jonathan Lavoy for Zachary Hoff in court for Zachery James Shircel.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA JJ Crawford. Called @ 3:31 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for 2nd status. Record by Atty. Lavoy that he was informed the State has a new referral, but it has not been charged yet. State responds to Court's questions regarding new complaint and orders it must be filed by September 30, 2022. Court sets next status out about 60 days so Atty. can go over new complaint with defendant. Court in recess.
Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

9:21 AM Case called. Prosecuting attorney Zeke S Wiedenfeld in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Zachery James Shircel in court.  Attorney Lavoy on behalf of Zachary Hoff in court for Zachery James Shircel. 
Atty Lavoy asks for 30-45 days. 
No victim present. 
No objection to adjournment. 
Status hearing set for September 15, 2022 @ 3pm, 2363.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Zachery James Shircel in court.  Attorney Zachary Hoff in court for Zachery James Shircel. Motion to modify bond by Attorney Hoff. Argument, granted. No contact provision removed. Defendant has completed AODA and counseling. Victim is present in courtroom and addressed the court. Minutes filed.
Defense Letter to Court Regarding Request to Drop No Contact
Victim's Request to Lift the No Contact
Defendant's Request to Lift the No Contact. Control Plan filed.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

Defendant Zachery James Shircel in court.  Attorney Zachary Hoff in court for Zachery James Shircel. Prosecuting attorney Zeke S Wiedenfeld in court for the State of Wisconsin. Reading of complaint waived. Bond remains. Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Zachary Hoff

*AMENDMENT 6-22-2022 - NO CONTACT PROVISION REMOVED. 

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH DJAF dob 8-28-1990 or RESIDENCE. If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
